p: For their broad spectrum of possible pharmacological and biological activities, NPs can be suitable candidate for their effects on multifactorial diseases, such as neurodegeneration and cancer ( Balunas & Kinghorn, 2005). For example, the alkaloid colchicine, by inhibiting tubulin assembly, therefore suppressing microtubule formation and cell division, is able to block cell cycle leading to cell death ( Kaplan et al., 1986). Other compounds inhibit the activity of DNA topoisomerases I (e.g. the alkaloid camptothecin) and II (e.g the antracicline doxorubicin), but also the activity of other key enzymes in DNA replication and transcription ( Gamet-Payrastre et al., 2000).
